trans-unit.source: Provides a simple way to create and manage the contents of connection strings used by the EntityClient.

The connection string builder lets developers programmatically create syntactically correct connection strings, and parse and rebuild existing connection strings, by using properties and methods of the class.
The connection string builder provides strongly typed properties corresponding to the known keyword/value pairs.
Developers who must create connection strings as part of applications can use the EntityConnectionStringBuilder class to build and modify connection strings.
The EntityConnectionStringBuilder performs checks for valid keyword/value pairs, each of which is exposed as a EntityConnectionStringBuilder property value.
> [!NOTE] > The connection string for the underlying data source is supplied by the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder.ProviderConnectionString%2A> property.
The supplied provider connection string is not checked for valid keyword/value pairs.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> class using the supplied connection string.
The supplied `connectionString` is not checked for valid keyword/value pairs.
For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.
The invariant Provider name must be specified in the `connectionString` parameter.
Supported providers include the following: - `System.Data.Odbc` - `System.Data.OleDb` - `System.Data.OracleClient` - `System.Data.SqlClient` - `Microsoft.SqlServerCe.Client`
A provider-specific connection string to the underlying data source.
Clears the contents of the <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> instance.

The Clear method removes all keyword/value pairs from the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder> and resets all corresponding properties to null (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]).
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> contains a specific key.
The key to locate in the <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.

Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> contains an element that has the specified key; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> has a fixed size.

Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> in every case, because the <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> supplies a fixed-size collection of keyword/value pairs.
Gets or sets the value associated with the specified key.
In C#, this property is the indexer.

Because the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder> contains a fixed-size dictionary, trying to add a key that does not exist in the dictionary throws a <xref:System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException>.
For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.
The key of the item to get or set.
The value associated with the specified key.
keyword is a null reference ( in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]).
Tried to add a key that does not exist in the available keys.
Invalid value in the connection string (specifically, a Boolean or numeric value was expected but not supplied).
Gets an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains the keys in the <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.
An <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains the keys in the <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
Gets or sets the metadata locations in the connection string.
For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.
Gets or sets the metadata locations in the connection string.
Gets or sets the name of a section as defined in a configuration file.
For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.
The name of a section in a configuration file.
Gets or sets the name of the underlying [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] data provider in the connection string.
The invariant provider name is used retrieve the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbProviderFactory> object for the underlying provider.
For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.
The invariant name of the underlying [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] data provider.
Gets or sets the inner, provider-specific connection string.
The provider-specific connection string is not checked for valid keyword/value pairs before it is set.
Developers can create connection strings by using either a strongly typed connection string builder class, or they can use the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> class.
The <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> performs no checks for valid keyword/value pairs.
Therefore, it is possible using this class to create invalid connection strings.
For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.
The inner, provider-specific connection string.
Removes the entry with the specified key from the <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> instance.

Because the `Remove` method returns a value that indicates its success, it is not required to look for a key before trying to remove the keyword/value pair from the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder> instance.
The key of the keyword/value pair to be removed from the connection string in this <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.

Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the key existed in the connection string and was removed; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the key did not exist.
keyword is null ( in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)])
Retrieves a value corresponding to the supplied key from this <xref href="System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.

The TryGetValue method lets developers safely retrieve a value from a <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder> without having to verify that the supplied key name is a valid key name.
`TryGetValue` does not raise an exception when it is passed a nonexistent key.
Calling `TryGetValue` with a nonexistent key puts the value null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) in the `value` parameter.
The key of the item to retrieve.
The value corresponding to `keyword.`
Returns if keyword was found in the connection string; otherwise, .
keyword contains a null value ( in Visual Basic).
